meanings.sent1: The airscrew on the plane helped it fly smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic checked the airscrew before takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The airscrew decided to take a break and spin in the park.
meanings.sent4: The airscrew of progress turned slowly but surely.
meanings.sent5: The shiny airscrew gleamed in the sunlight as the plane soared.

meanings.definition: To rotate or propel using an airscrew.
meanings.sent1: The pilot had to airscrew the engine to start the plane.
meanings.sent2: She airscrewed the handle to open the window.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to airscrew the lid off the jar of pickles.
meanings.sent4: He airscrewed his way through the dense forest, clearing a path.
meanings.sent5: The wind airscrewed the leaves in a whirlwind around the yard.
